<<<<<<< HEAD
By the King. A proclamation for restraint of killing, dressing, and eating of flesh in Lent, or on fish-days, appointed by the law to be observed. England and Wales. Sovereign (1660-1685 : Charles II) Charles II, King of England, 1630-1685.
4 sheets (versos blank)
Printed by John Bill, printer to the King's most excellent Majesty, London : 1660 [i.e. 1661]. At the King's Printing-House in Black-Friers.
At end of text: Given at our palace at Whitehall, the twenty ninth day of January, in the twelfth year of our reign, one thousand six hundred and sixty. The date is given according to Lady Day dating. Steele notation: providence Provisions 2) King- 3) the 4) se- of; Arms 60. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
